website_summaries.verdict: Mood book depicts 20 different moods for children to understand and express.
pros: Kids can use the book to express moods as needed
Helps kids take control of their own emotional well-being
cons: Some buyers would like to see more in-depth emotions explored in the book

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for young children
customer_reviews.text: I am a child psychologist with highly motivated parents on my caseload. One of my moms brought in your book with her 4 year old, who loved it. I have since bought one myself and sent one for my grandchild.. and notice other parents are using this with their kids. One suggestion, that would expand it for use with older children: a set of stickers for writing down additional suggestions of things to do? And if they could be removable, even better. A good product, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: glinda

customer_reviews.title: My grandson actually uses this on his own.
customer_reviews.text: My six year old grandson was having trouble dealing with his emotions and became disruptive in school. I purchased this flipbook and a few other aids and he loves them. He refers to the flip book on his own when he needs to and even approaches other family members asking “ how do you feel?” Then he offers suggestions from the book on what they can do to manage. His behavior has improved noticeably in response to the whole approach, the aids and the family support. It’s not an instant fix but definitely an important part of an overall successful plan of action.
customer_reviews.author: elora

customer_reviews.title: It's Cute, but Better for Home than School
customer_reviews.text: super cute monsters. more for families ...i/e, one entry is "what do i do when i feel....HUNGRY". and it gives ideas. so while i like it for anger, or shy, it's scope and sequence for use in a primary school comes up a little short.
customer_reviews.author: spychic

customer_reviews.title: Easy to understand and follow
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is very keen on identifying her emotions. This book stood out for me and I thought it was worth a try. I had no idea how much she'd like it. She's nearly memorized the appropriate reactions to different emotions. It's a powerful thing to watch her play with her dolls and play out emotions and how to react to them. This book is great.
customer_reviews.author: Angel R. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Give that emotion a name, and healthy outlet!
customer_reviews.text: Love the characters used to illustrate each emotion...my granddaughter (3), could recognize and relate to the simple ones...But it also will grow with her as she experien es more complex feelings. Also...the flip page with how to deal with the emotion on the back, will be helpful as she gets a bit older. So in reality, this book can be used in two stages. First to let the child recognize her emotions, and later, let mom or dad see suggestions for helping her find a healthy alternative for that emotion!
customer_reviews.author: M. Koch

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and bright
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old’s counselor recommended this to help him express what he is feeling since it’s very difficult for him to verbalize his emotions. It came quickly and in brand new condition. The pages are sturdy and the colors are bright. It might be a little juvenile for him, but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: LJM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing item for children to understand thier emotions
customer_reviews.text: I bought "my mood my choices" flip book for my 4yr old son. He has extreme impulse controll and emotional control issues. We have only had this item for a few days, but so far it has been helping. He can use the images to figure out how he feels and pick the action he want to do from the choices list for that emotion. It has work in a few situations before he could get too out of hand. Best thing i have bought recently. I completely recommend it for any household with children.
customer_reviews.author: Kryssi

customer_reviews.title: Misprinted pages
customer_reviews.text: Three of the pages had emotions that did not match the coping skills emotions. Meaning three of the pages were misprints :l. It would've been a great product otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Read the measurements carefully!
customer_reviews.text: The images of the flip book are misleading. Definitely read and map out the measurements so that you know the size of the product. I had thought to use this with my class for group behavior/coping/social skills lessons, but it really is too small for that. The colored pictures are cute, but the larger images are six inches by about 5 and a half inches. The pages with the smaller images really cannot be read at any reasonable distance. The student will have to be sitting beside or directly in front of you. I don't believe that it is worth the price being charged. I am giving 2 stars because it is colorful and appears sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this for my 4 year old Grandson who has started having some control issues and meltdowns so we thought this might help him identify how he's feeling and learn more positive ways to deal with them. He loved it right away and started setting it up when it was time to eat he puts it on the hungry monster, when it's bedtime he puts it on the sleepy monster, when it's time to do something fun he puts it on the excited monster. He even understand what the suggestions on the back mean. Some of the feelings are above his understand but he will learn them eventually.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for an emotionally tuned in toddler
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old has gotten really into emotions lately. She likes to talk about them, observe them, name them etc. I got her this flip book and she absolutely loves it and “reads it” to herself all the time. I don’t know that this is something most toddlers would do but for her, a kid who is fascinated by emotions, she loves this flip book. It’s super sturdy and easy for her to use too.
customer_reviews.author: Sizzle

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful artwork, A Bit Redundant
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 year old and he really clicked with it. He loves to turn to the page and talk about the activities to do with each feeling. The artwork is big, vivid, and beautiful. I only wish that the activities suggested were more varied as they are often the same for each feeling and feel very repetitive. Many are only useful for older children, so a variety might have helped reach across more ages.
customer_reviews.author: CrysD724

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure how much this book would help my 4 year old, but boy was I wrong! My daughter struggles to tell me what she’s feeling, just shuts down. After I got this I went over it with her page by page. The next day she got upset over a friend taking her toy so she went and grabbed it, brought it to me and pointed to the face she was feeling, so we did some of the recommended ideas and it worked! I’m so excited to be able to have something like this to help. I think over time it’s going to make all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Great resource for home
customer_reviews.text: My children, ages 5 and 7, were having a hard time managing emotions. I bought this on a week, and they have been utilizing the book! I found it flipped to the hungry page, and my daughter had grabbed carrots and yogurt to eat (a suggestion for feeling hungry is to eat a healthy snack). They have also been more aware of each others emotions and telling me, "mom, I think brother might need a hug."
customer_reviews.author: Mel O

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little item. I originally purchased it for my Special Needs Grandson, who often becomes frustrated and isn't able to get his feelings out. There are some good suggestions as to what he can do to release a particular emotion. However, not only does he use it, my other grandkids began using it as well. When someone gets upset, they talk about "going to the book" and looking to see what they can do. I think every classroom should have one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No for us
customer_reviews.text: Ok ish my autistic son really has no interest in this particular item. Seems stuff from smile4autism.com much better. He gets frustrated trying to get it to stand up. He has no interest in it nearly at all. The design I believe is more frustrating than if it were made like a book not a stand up book. Not for my son
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase of the year for me!
customer_reviews.text: my autistic son loves this. I wish I had this in the beginning of his journey when he was non verbal. Now he is speaking but loves to use this to tell me how he is feeling. I love the suggestions on the back of the emotions to resolve the feeling. This is super durable. We keep it on his desk but every morning I find it on my night stand with a changed emotion. Lol Really would recommend this for all parents not just with children with special needs.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi J.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a family were we are taught to hide our feelings, I want to make sure not to make that mistake with my children. Anytime I find something like this I will definitely try out. My son absolutely loved this, and so did my niece. Its great how they easily relate to the expression on the characters face allowing them to talk about when they made that face and how they felt at the time. They are both 5 and in kindergarten so its been great teaching them the appropriate way to react to their emotions. I did like the suggestion from a previous review regarding stickers to add more ideas of expression.
customer_reviews.author: Glo

customer_reviews.title: Super cute and practical
customer_reviews.text: I am makign at at-home "calming corner" to try and help my kids figure out their emotions. I was worried my 6 year old might be too old and my 3 year old too young. My 6 year old gravitated immediately to the monster illustrations and wanted to read them all and define what the emotions meant. He loves it. My 3 year old knew what the monsters were feeling and the graphics really were loved. I am excited for it to be a staple in my house when things get hard and used consistently I think will help teach us all that we need to stop and think about what to do!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 2year old nephew LOOOOVED it
customer_reviews.text: My very active and energetic terrible two’s representative nephew loved these flip book. From the beginning he was very amused by the monster’s expressions and quickly was repeating some of the emotions’ words like Happy and Grumpy. After a couple of days when I would ask “Are you feeling grumpy?” at times when he was having a bit of a tantrum he would immediately change his face and say “noooo, happy!”
customer_reviews.author: Andrea T.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for kids!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have this on my kitchen counter. I have a 5 yr old autistic son who has trouble communicating. I have a 6 yr old son who has trouble managing his emotions. My 8 yr son is usually telling me he’s bored and also has trouble managing his emotions. This is a great tool for them! My 8 yr old was bored the other day and went up the the flip book and looked for the “bored” card to see what the suggestions were.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what my son needed and I am so happy I stumbled across it. I've been stressing the make good choices motto for a while now to my children, and have made these same suggestions to them countless times when they come to me "bored" or "frustrated". This flipbook turns positive options into something they can see and choose independently and my son especially loves that. He's very much into the "I'm a big boy, I don't need help, I can do it myself" stage since starting kindergarten and he loves having this flipbook to refer to when he's at a loose end. Would recommend to anyone 1000%.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool for little ones
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful and helpful guide for children to identify their mood and choose a skill to cope and manage that emotion. I was pleasantly surprised that my 5 year old granddaughter was open to reading it. We read through the whole book. Now, when she is aware of feeling a particular way, she refers to the choices, sometimes not even needing the book to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Y. A. Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs context for kids
customer_reviews.text: Fun bright pictures with good ideas for dealing with emotions. Only problem was that not everything on the list is an emotion. Also, most emotions are actually four base emotions (fear, sadness, happiness, anger) put context so it is important to explain that to your kids.
customer_reviews.author: G. Zane

customer_reviews.title: Key to understanding
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves it. It offers some advise to the child as to how they can handle a mood, but it doesn't offer more than what you've probably already taught the child. Child would need to know how to read to understand the advise. I give it 4 stars because it is durable, my child really likes it, and my child will show me the current mood on it (therefore opening the door to communication and understanding).
customer_reviews.author: Cactus

customer_reviews.title: 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 6 year old to help him express himself at home and in school. His teacher loves the idea. He loves reading it. The best part is when you go to a feeling your child can go to the back and they give suggestions of what they can do when they feel a certain way
customer_reviews.author: SVTG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kid-hands and kid-use
customer_reviews.text: My 5.5 year old loves the book and will proudly display the emotion she is feeling at her place at the table. When she feels differently she will get it and change it. I'm glad she likes the book and even when neat-- the book is forgiving--- it's laminated-- so it's easy to dry, wipe clean, and dust off! Thanks for the great resource :) Erin
customer_reviews.author: Erin Kelly Brown

customer_reviews.title: Cute and helpful
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 4 and sometimes gets really flustered trying to express how she is feeling. This flipbook is great because it has helped her learn new words to name her feelings or identify the feelings of others (because of the cute monster pictures), and then we can talk about tips for how to deal with that feeling. I've noticed a huge improvement in her overall behavior and coping with her big feelings.
customer_reviews.author: MOwley

customer_reviews.title: I like this so much I want another
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kiddos at home. I liked it so much I want to purchase another for my special ed classroom. Now the only negative I could say is that I think some of the visuals could be clearer. It wasn't negative enough for me because I want another. I love the flip side where it gives strategies and ideas which are nice talking points for handling big feelings.
customer_reviews.author: Evvy

customer_reviews.title: Umm better tools out there
customer_reviews.text: Not the best tool for teaching. It loses interest and when a meltdown occurs it is not the most accepted tool to utilize by the tantrum thrower. Even after working with kids when they are not throwing a tantrum with it before a tantrum thrown. It also offers the same repeated coping skills for every emotion practically.
customer_reviews.author: Sshehadeh

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3 year old and it is helpful in talking about emotions and what we can do when they seem to be too much. It can stand up on a desk. We put it on the breakfast table to talk about while eating. Great book!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Seay

customer_reviews.title: Handy for sure
customer_reviews.text: It may seem like it’s not sturdy taking it out from the package but be sure to unfold the white base and kinda play with it a little. It’ll stand up fine once it’s “broken in”. Takes a minute. Anyway, my 3.5 loves this. He seems to enjoy letting me know how he feels, flips thru till the little monster matches the way he feels then we talk about it. Every kid is different but this seems like it would benefit all kids 3+
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Ertle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome learning tool
customer_reviews.text: I thought it might be too young for my 5 year old but she loves it. I wish there were a space to add your own as it can get repetitive and every family is different but I have been adding little notes. Like. When she’s bored she can clean up her damn toys lol. Or to be nice when she’s angry.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Just ok and duplicate pages.
customer_reviews.text: There was some duplicate pages and I was hoping it contained more emotions like silly and options for calming down. Not bad but didn't fit my needs. This is more geared for at home than at school.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney N

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for assisting children in identifying their feelings (reflectiveness, introspection). The alternatives listed give the children something concrete to help them learn how to self-regulate and de-escalate. It is simple to use. The base will need some finagling to stand properly (the item has been in its shipping position for awhile; may need to add a weight to the base until the item is able to sit flat on a surface.
customer_reviews.author: KGB

customer_reviews.title: Great Way to Teach Children About Emotions
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to help me with my son and he has begun using it to help express how he feels and tips for how to react when in specific feelings. I'd highly recommend especially for children with sensory or speech issues to learn how to express themselves and validation of their feelings.
customer_reviews.author: trackgrad08

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and user friendly activity book.
customer_reviews.text: My students liked it. It was a little redundant if u flip through the book some of the coping strategies repeat.
customer_reviews.author: biao22

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for emotional kids
customer_reviews.text: My child liked the book initially and would go to the book when feeling like one of the emotions in it. The problem was that we did not have one with us everywhere and he started being annoyed when we could not use it to change direction or if one of the solutions offered was not something that could be done at the time, like a suggestion to play outdoors or with friends and it was bedtime or raining.
customer_reviews.author: See_Alycia

customer_reviews.title: Love this book
customer_reviews.text: I keep my mood book on the table. We read through the book for the little ones every other week. My older kids go to the table and will flip the book to how they are feeling, or pretending to feel lol One little girl is always putting it on shy, but that she's not :)
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great therapeutic tool that kids love.
customer_reviews.text: I am a therapist who works with children in Treatment Foster Care. I have purchased three of these so far and my friend created a fundraiser for me and so far 13 of these books have been purchased for our Kiddos. The kids in care love these books. They love reading it themselves and looking at the pictures. I did a small training for the staff in my Organization and now have a flip Chart in every office.
customer_reviews.author: Karol Barber

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 3
customer_reviews.text: We bought the first one as a gift. The second for ourselves and third one when a grandchild saw it here they said “I want one of those” Those 2-4 could use it with older help , ages 5 -early teens too ( depending on your child) easy to use, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bingo Bird

customer_reviews.title: Good size and bright colors
customer_reviews.text: My niece has been working through emotions and the large colorful images help her choose different activities when she is feeling frustrated or angry. She keeps it on the dresser next to her bed.
customer_reviews.author: CJOY98

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Grateful!
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure how my non-verbal autistic 5 year old grandson would take to this tool. We live 3000 miles apart. However, my son said he loves the book. His big sister immediately started working with him to understand what it was, going over the different feelings and moods. His parents, sister and I are excited for him to finally be able to tell us how he feels. I am sure this will help him feel less frustrated. We are beyond grateful for this amazing tool and the reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: My kids (5- and 3-years-old) frequently go to this chart to remind themselves of their choices when feeling different emotions they are not sure what to do with. Being able to have choices readily available to them when they are angry or bored, or even excited, has especially been great.
customer_reviews.author: AJTurner

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy/ would have returned if the time hadn't already passed.
customer_reviews.text: Each page/ emotion solution just basically repeats all the other emotions solutions. All very basic, not worth the $
customer_reviews.author: M. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: great mood check in!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy to receive my mood flip chart. It has a great selection of feelings, with visually catchy pictures. It is easy to flip and seems sturdy. I love that it includes strategies for each feeling of ways to cope when you are having that feeling. I plan to use it for a mood check in with the children I work with in therapy. I am comfortable recommending it to others.
customer_reviews.author: violet sundermeyer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for PreK-1st students
customer_reviews.text: My son (5) instantly understood and enjoyed this flipbook. It sparked a great conversation about other things he can do beyond the suggestions on the cards. It's easy to use, easy to understand, and a great teaching tool about emotional regulation.
customer_reviews.author: Anne C

customer_reviews.title: Helpful when words are not working
customer_reviews.text: I like this book, trying to get my daughter to use it. Durable she was unable to distroy it, even when upset
customer_reviews.author: Beth McKinley

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple tool to help children identify their feelings and provide options that will help regulate them. Younger kids will need parental/adult guidance but my older ASD level 1 kiddo will be able to read and response without assistance.
customer_reviews.author: svea bryan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective.
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old really responds to this flip book. It helps identify feelings based on pictures, and you can help your child pick positive choices / solutions based on that emotion. Helps ease frustration by teaching them to express how they are feeling. My child picked up on the pictures immediately. Great buy. Wish I had found this a lot sooner.
customer_reviews.author: J. Petty

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids, they love it and now bring it out to figure out how they are feeling. Opens up conversation in a fun & constructive way. We try to further expand on what you can do when feeling a certain way as the choices are limited & repeated. They clearly appreciate it, so a big win in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: OS

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I will be sharing this with our family counselor. Great images to show the emotion. Lots of good ideas for how to change the behavior in comparison to the behavior. The pictures are helpful for my kids. Great reference tool!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Woodhams

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic ❤️ Worth every penny, plus some
customer_reviews.text: Great concept for kids! This has definitely helped my boys to not only identify their feelings but also to find solutions or actions for those feelings. I would absolutely recommended this product and this company. Excellent customer service resolved a sight issue that I had immediately and in a very satisfactory manner, including a handwritten note.
customer_reviews.author: AmyD

customer_reviews.title: Bright, colorful, durable, and helpful.
customer_reviews.text: I use this item with my younger therapy clients, to help teach about recognizing emotions and to encourage coping skills for those emotions. My one wish is that they would add more variety of ways to cope (drawing shows up on most of them), and add a blank space for each emotion, so that the child could come his/her own ideas. Still, good item ... recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ronni

customer_reviews.title: Great especially for non verbal children
customer_reviews.text: The book is smaller than I thought but that’s perfect because it fits right on his desk. My son has autism and since he’s mainly non verbal, this is like a flash card version he can’t lose since it’s much bigger and is connected.
customer_reviews.author: Deja

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is really great, it helps my kids identify alternate choices they can make. We use it as a conversation starter frequently. I also love that everything has a picture as well, my 5 year old who is learning to read uses both pictogram and words.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great counseling tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have this sitting in my office as an option for my clients to use. I’d love to use it more often. It is a pretty incredible tool with great coping skill options! It would be great if this company came out with another one with more emotions!
customer_reviews.author: NateL

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Much needed to help my son Express himself. Durable, easy to use, good size. But the best part was the costumer services. The first on I received had a miss print and they replaced it right away. Which I truly appreciated!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for kids who need help with emotional regulation
customer_reviews.text: My daughter keeps this in her backpack. When we opened it she went through every emotion and acted out all the choices. I'm not sure she uses it at school but I think it helps her just knowing it's there. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: So Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Our 4 year old foster son loves this book - it really helps him to identify his emotions, and we like to pick 1-2 things from the opposite side that we can do to help us overcome that particular emotion. Very helpful and recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Phipps13

customer_reviews.title: Major improvement in behavior
customer_reviews.text: My son was getting in trouble at school for hitting, kicking, biting, etc. I bought this for him to help him slow down his thought process. It has really helped. We sent it to school with him and he grabs it when he feels angry, frustrated, scared, etc. His teachers love it so much they asked me where I got it! Now he identifies the feeling and chooses a “good choice” to make.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nutt

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old son with ASD this has been a really good tool for him to use at school since he has trouble communicating it helps so much his teacher even loves it! She said she took it to a meeting suggesting it for other students like him!
customer_reviews.author: tamarah

customer_reviews.title: Room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: I would like to see some description of the mood that would be understandable to a child. It just says what to do when you’re in that certain mood, but how is the child supposed to know what mood they’re in
customer_reviews.author: MaeNet

customer_reviews.title: Love this flipbook!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely recommend this book, especially for toddlers who are emotional and have a difficult time expressing how they feel (without crying!). The pictures are bright and the book is easy to understand. Easy to follow!
customer_reviews.author: Aree SD

customer_reviews.title: Cool book :)
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Can easily stand on its own. My 11 year old loves being able to visually pick her moods. It's a cute mood book and my daughter loves the pictures. She has autism and it was great add to get her more into recognizing emotions to be able to visually express how she's feeling when it feels a bit confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great for a class/clinic
customer_reviews.text: We initially used this book as part of a Headstart activity and now I keep them in the rooms of my pediatric clinic for families to look through. I like all of the options for what to do when we feel a certain way. The only slightly constructive feedback I got is that there seem to be more "negative" emotions than positive--overall I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Great to help identify emotions !
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. We have a calm down corner in out home and this has been an amazing addition. the boys love flipping through and telling me how they feel. I love that it has multiple solutions for each emotion to try . Only complaint it wont stand up with the stand at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Great emotion flip chart. Portable for on the go.
customer_reviews.text: I really like using this in therapy with kids to go over emotions. You can even act out facial expressions with it. Sturdy and small so you can take it on the go if you don't have an office.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Good reference for kids learning mindfulness
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty cute. I got this to support mindfulness. My 5 year old son has had strong emotions and it about broke my heart when he told me he didn’t know how to calm down. We use this when he needs to check his emotions and it has been a good tool for us to turn to.
customer_reviews.author: Kaileen McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy book
customer_reviews.text: The reason it lost a star was because the box wasnt in perfect condition when it arrived but the book itself looked new. I'm hoping this helps for my kids when they are upset instead of not knowing how to deal with their feelings.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching emotions
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 2 year old grandson. He has some issues with speech. He's mastered the "happy" page so far. Some of the emotions are a bit above his age level, but I think he'll grow into it if we keep referencing the most relevant ones.
customer_reviews.author: Lori A

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning emotions
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 1/2 to 5 year old preschool class. Not only does it show emotions, but it gives great, easy to understand, choices and ideas for what to do in that emotion. Lots of great coping skills!
customer_reviews.author: C. Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for child with severe ADHD and high functioning autism
customer_reviews.text: I was relieved and thrilled at how much my 9 year old daughter responded to this book. She carried it around for a week! Great resource to help build communication and teach her how to understand appropriate behaviors based on what she is feeling. The only small disappointment is they do use a lot of the same "suggestions" for all of the moods. Would still recommend and buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: I love how this has multiple feelings on it vs some of the others that have only a few emotions. My daughter really like the pictures. We will have to use it more to see how much it helps but overall I feel the quality was great for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Snowleopard22

customer_reviews.title: Cute idea
customer_reviews.text: Love this, I just wish they had an age appropriate definition or social story to go with each emotion to make the abstract conceptof feelings more relatable for young ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jahosh

customer_reviews.title: Great for figuring out how you’re feeling
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I loved using this to find things she can do when feeling certain ways or just help identifying her emotions altogether. Nice that it can sit on display and be changed at will
customer_reviews.author: Jo schmoe

customer_reviews.title: Special Education Teacher and Mom
customer_reviews.text: I am not only the mom to two beautifully neuro-diverse little boys but I am also a special education teacher. This flip book I use at home and at work. It is easy to use, effective, and can be used for multiple different lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Charyse

customer_reviews.title: Cute book, looks used.
customer_reviews.text: Cute little book, looking forward to using it with my kiddos. I rated a 3 because it arrived in a ripped box with some of the pages crinkled as if it had been used.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Westerman

customer_reviews.title: great for children to actually express their moods.
customer_reviews.text: I have a great granddaughter who has ADHD/ODD and this is actually helping her to cope with her different mood swings. She doesn't get yelled at as ;much by her parents
customer_reviews.author: WhiteDove

customer_reviews.title: Cute Concept
customer_reviews.text: My ADHD 5yo is a little too immature to understand this currently but hoping it is a tool we can use soon. It is great quality, great ideas, and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Special Needs Momma

customer_reviews.title: Great for home and classroom!
customer_reviews.text: An excellent way to talk to my children about the different emotions they are feeling and positive actions they can take in regards to each feeling, including Happiness. Very sturdy, would be great for a classroom! My sons will now request the feelings book/chart to look at what “Positive” steps they can take next. It makes me feel so good, considering we have been experiencing big feelings in our house lately with a 1, 3, & 5 year old running around.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I purchased it to use with my 6 year old grandson who is unable to communicate verbally and has Autism. He is able to understand the emotions depicted and the hints on the back are helpful as well. Also sturdy and made to last! Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Collins

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great idea especially for my son who has adhd. The problem is keeping it standing up and the bottom tearing. The pages are well made and so is the spiral bind. I just was dissatisfied with the bottom fold.
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good book for kids to learn what positive actions to take depending how they feel. Also it is very good that the action has visual image. That way it is even good for younger kids, who can't read. It will plant visual image in their brain, how to react when certain feelings come up. It would be useful for adults as well. :) For adults it would make great office gift :)
customer_reviews.author: Piret Jurise

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: My son does not have any of the special needs but has been showing defiant behavior. I purchased the school especially for school and it has helped him make better choices. I think its a great book for both special needs and children who show challenging behaviors for whatever reason.
customer_reviews.author: Elianne jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Cute, clear illustrations and simple interventions to help children manage feelings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this flipbook to help my 4 year old with his emotions. The illustrations are cute and clear. The suggested interventions are helpful and easy for a child to understand. My son likes the book and is interested in talking about the feelings and interventions. Customer service was extremely helpful when a page was missing, they sent out a new book right away.
customer_reviews.author: Sara A

customer_reviews.title: Not really impressed
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t that impressed, most of the exercises are repeats. I’d rather use google for suggestions than this book. Other than that, my girls loved the monster illustrations.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my autistic son who has trouble with speech and feelings and this has been a wonderful product for him to use. Easy to use and the pictures are very helpful for him to express what he is feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. ❤️
customer_reviews.text: I love this book to teach kids about there feelings and how to handle it. Perfect totally would recommend it and it is small so it can go in your bag and on the go. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun drawings that are helpful
customer_reviews.text: I have used this at my house and our little man has found it helpful as he continues to work on expressing his emotions. He is learning how to share what he is feeling and positive ways to determine what he is feeling and how to manage those emotions. I look forward to sharing this with the students I have in the school's after care program.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C

customer_reviews.title: Great for children with ADHD
customer_reviews.text: My child has ADHD and sometimes has difficulty articulating their feelings. This flip book was a fun way for us to discuss how we're feeling and gave helpful tips on how to make it better. Sometimes words fail our ADHD kiddos and this is a great way to get them communicating in a different way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great learning book
customer_reviews.text: Great little book for toddlers and kids. Sturdy, great graphics and the perfect size for little hands. Definitely helps them learn about feelings.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to use for anger management
customer_reviews.text: As described.. but I thought the large would be a lot bigger.. now I see that the smaller travel size is 4.5x4.5 and the large is 6x6..
customer_reviews.author: KM218

customer_reviews.title: Great for small children to identify their feelings
customer_reviews.text: Easy for small children to understand and helps them not only learn to identify their feelings, but figure out constructive ways to deal with their emotions.
customer_reviews.author: Chicagomum

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Mood Flipbook
customer_reviews.text: Very important for children to be able to express their feelings. This is an effective to tool which facilitates awareness and gives children an easy way to identify feelings.
customer_reviews.author: Joan M. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: It stands up great to use one on one
customer_reviews.text: I love how it stands up, i teach in a CHILDCARE center its to help them recognizing and expressing and prpcessing emmotions
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: I am a licensed counselor and I use this book with children of all ages. They love the colorful pages that capture their feelings and they appreciate the tips about some possible responses to their feelings.
customer_reviews.author: Laura K

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter is 4 and very opinionated! These books have been very helpful in getting her on track with her feelings. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Get this for your kids. Great investment. My kids look for it and use it almost daily to express themselves as well as expressions for one another.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for todler who can't fully express themselves.
customer_reviews.text: Our 3yr old was having big feelings and unable to Express himself when upset. This product helps his calm down as he looks for the photo that applies and shows me his current emotion. He also pulls it out when excited & happy. We enjoy the added page with suggestions on how to work through those feelings.
customer_reviews.author: Beatriz Gonzalez

product_meta.title: The Original Mood Flipbook for Kids; 20 Different Moods/Emotions; Autism; ADHD; Help Kids Identify Feelings and Make Positive Choices; Laminated Pages (Emoji Flipbook)
feature_bullets: EDUCATIONAL TOOL. Teach kids about different moods/emotions and positive actions that can be taken in a fun and educational way.

20 DIFFERENT MOODS ARE INCLUDED. Angry, bored, confident, confused, disappointed, embarrassed, excited, frustrated, grumpy, guilty, happy, hopeful, hungry, sad, scared, shy, sick, sleepy, stressed, and worried. Kids will enjoy flipping to the character that expresses their current mood, and the corresponding positive choices that can be taken.

LAMINATED PAGES. Every page is laminated for extra durability. Pages are easy to wipe off which is a must with young children. A built-in stand is included. The large (standard) size measures 6 x 6 inches. The small (travel) size measures 4.5 x 4.5 inches and is perfect for the car ride, backpack, and timeout corner.
HIGH QUALITY MATERIALS. This flipbook has been made with solid construction. The binder rings are thick, and the stand is very sturdy – perfect for kids!

HELPFUL LEARNING AID. This is a helpful learning tool for ANY child, particularly those in preschool, kindergarten and elementary school. Also, the flipbook is helpful for children with Autism, ADHD, or special needs. It's perfect for displaying at home, school, and counseling offices.
